Bag O' Links - 4/5/2009

My 200th post. yai.

  • Using yUML with JQuery – a few days ago i had a link to the yUML library, a nice <img/> usage to draw diagrams, this tutorial shows how to use it with JQuery.
  • Rails for fun an profit – a list of projects/initiatives you can join and program rails for fun/profit.
  • Capistrano Wiki – the Capistrano knowledge base.
  • Ruby toolbox – What do those rubists use…
  • Hide/Show mysteries – Hiding and showing HTML elements with CSS and/or Javascript.
  • CSS’S :content, :counter-increment and other surprises – Some selectors you probably don’t know.
  • Rails integration testing with integrity – Nice tutorial.
  • Bootstrapping Rails – another attempt to create a basic skeleton.
  • Ruby Warrior – a turn based ruby game to help in teaching ruby to new programmers.
  • LOLcode – Ha, i love it. a programming language inplementation of the LOLCats syntax.
